slander.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a false spoken statement about someone, intended to damage the good opinion that people have of that person
slander.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the crime of making false spoken statements about someone
slander.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: He is being sued for slander.
slander.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to say false things about someone in order to damage other people’s good opinion of them
slander.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a spoken statement about someone that is not true and is intended to damage the good opinion that people have of him or her, or the legal offence of making a statement of this kind
slander.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The company is being sued for slander by four pharmacists who say the retailer publicly ruined their reputations.
slander.translation[3].definitions[0].de: to say untrue things about someone in order to damage other people’s good opinion of them
slander.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Smith slandered him by accusing him of proposing an illegal business deal.
